page.title: 09 Industry in Polstead
page.content: Ainger's brush factory operates in the old mill in Mill Lane.The last corn was milled there in 1926.The brush factory employs eleven people and produces twenty-thousand brush handles a day,also clay modelling tools. A fine art printer operates in the former village shop,but employs no other help. Nearby the Polstead Cottage Press is a further new enterprise. The author Ruth Rendell has recently come to live and work in the peace of a Polstead lane. Several ladies provide a welcome hairdressing service travelling round to people's houses. A woodcarver lives and works at Whitestreet Green.
